text: Widely Figure 3B ). The Sputnik virophage is from the same Baltimore class, dsDNA, as its host, Mimivirus, and excessive HGT from the host has been reported in this case [24] . Therefore, although these viruses represent distant families, all of them have the same type of genome. The fold in these structures has been dubbed double jelly roll, and it is also a frequent motif in viral capsid proteins [61] [62] [63] [64] . As is typical for capsid proteins, this fold is also found exclusively in viruses.
